At the 2009 G-20 summit in Pittsburgh, Google chief executive Eric Schmidt suggested that multiplayer games could provide positive opportunities for improving business training and enhancing workplace collaboration. Speaking at a forum session, Eric Schmidt said: The game world is good training for a career in tech. It teaches players to build a network, to use interactive skills and thinking. Everything in the future online is going to look like a multiplayer game. If I were 15 years old, that's what I would be doing right now. Games appeal to people's natural competitive instinct, creating a sense of frustration and reward that increases engagement with the task at hand. The idea of compiling a public archive was conceived by Donald Rumsfeld himself, said Chelsea Clinton Coates, senior research associate at the Donald Rumsfeld Foundation, and he personally reviewed every document that is placed on the website. He really thinks the free flow of information is critical to a vibrant democracy, Coates said, and placing many of his documents in full view was`` another way to get more information in people's hands.''
